articles.article_title: Enthusiasm for Trump's rally in Arizona dwarfs President Biden's town hall just days earlier
core_claims_gemini_naive: President Biden's town hall in Cincinnati had low attendance, with images showing a mostly empty auditorium.
In contrast, former President Trump's rally in Phoenix, Arizona, drew a large crowd, exceeding the venue's capacity.
Trump's rally focused on election integrity and the Maricopa County audit.
The difference in attendance highlights a significant enthusiasm gap between Trump and Biden.
The large turnout at Trump's rally, despite negative media coverage, suggests strong support for election integrity concerns.
The contrast in crowd sizes is concerning for Democrats regarding the 2022 midterms and the 2024 presidential election.
core_claims_llama: President Joe Biden had a town hall event in the Cincinnati area with a mostly empty auditorium.
Former President Trump appeared in Phoenix, Arizona, for an election integrity rally with a large crowd.
Trump's rally had a huge line of supporters waiting to get in, with many being turned away after the venue reached capacity.
The crowd at Trump's rally was estimated to be around 5,000 people, with thousands more outside waiting to get in.
Trump's rally was in support of election integrity laws and the ongoing audit of the 2020 election in Maricopa County.
core_claims_reader_1: President Joe Biden had a town hall event […] the town hall was virtually empty.
What most people noticed about the event was some of Biden's strange answers during the event
Trump being more popular than people think (and Biden being less popular than the media cheerleaders make him out to be)
Trump is outdrawing Joe Biden easily
He [Biden] can't generate any kind of enthusiasm. Trump can
core_claims_reader_2: There is a lack of enthusiasm for Biden, reflected by poor turnout at his town hall event in Cincinnati
Biden made verbal gaffes and incoherence during the event are presented as being significant and embarrassing

There is enthusiasm for Trump: In contrast to Biden's event, Trump’s rally in Phoenix attracted a large, enthusiastic crowd, with the venue reaching capacity and additional supporters outside in extreme heat
This enthusiasm for Trump persists despite his consistent negative media coverage
Trump’s rally focused on “election integrity,” particularly the audit of the 2020 election in Maricopa County, Arizona, which resonates strongly with his base
core_claims_reader_3: Donald trump mobilizes more attendees to his rallies than biden
Biden was speaking incoherently at one of his rallies
People had to be turned away at trump's rally for election integrity in arizona
Biden's townhall meeting in Cincinnati was virtually empty
People can be mobilized with rallies about election integrity
core_claims_reader_4: Joe Biden had a town hall event in the Cincinnati area
During the event, Joe Biden gave strange answers
The town hall was virtually empty
Trump was speaking “Rally for Election Integrity”, which was well-attended
There is a popularity gap between Biden and Trump, with the latter being much more popular

articles.article_title: Banks: Pelosi Doesn't Want 'Tough Questions' Because She's Responsible for Breakdown of Security on Jan. 6'
core_claims_gemini_naive: Speaker Nancy Pelosi rejected House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy's choices for the January 6th select committee, including Representatives Jim Banks and Jim Jordan.
Rep. Banks argues Pelosi's rejection was because she feared tough questions and only wants a narrative that supports her predetermined view of the events.
Banks claims Pelosi is ultimately responsible for the security failures on January 6th due to her authority over Capitol Police.
Banks points to intelligence reports from three weeks before January 6th that the Capitol Police leadership was aware of potential threats.
Banks suggests unreleased documents from the Speaker's office implicate Pelosi in the security failures.
Banks criticizes Pelosi's decision to create a select committee instead of a bipartisan commission, arguing it prevents a balanced investigation.
Banks highlights the unprecedented nature of Pelosi rejecting the minority party's choices for the committee.
core_claims_llama: Pelosi objected to Rep. Jim Banks being picked for the select committee because she was afraid of 'tough questions'.
Pelosi is 'only interested in a narrative' and wants answers that fit that narrative.
Pelosi has already predetermined a narrative about Donald Trump and Republicans.
Pelosi is ultimately responsible for the breakdown of security at the Capitol on January 6.
Pelosi objected to Rep. Jim Banks and Rep. Jim Jordan being picked for the select committee because she didn't want them to ask questions about the vulnerability of the Capitol on January 6.
core_claims_reader_1: The congressman [Banks] was one of House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy's (R-CA) five picks for the committee, though McCarthy pulled all five after Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) rejected Banks and Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH).
Banks found out over Twitter that Pelosi objected to him being picked.
Pelosi was going with a select committee, which she confirmed a few days later. Only two Republicans, Reps. Cheney and Adam Kinzinger (IL) voted in favor of it.
Speaker Pelosi on Sunday officially named Rep. Kinzinger to fill one of the spots, which he accepted.
Cheney had been chosen and accepted last week.
core_claims_reader_2: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is advancing the January 6 Select Committee in a partisan manner

***minor***Congress had considered investigating the Capitol riot in the form of a special commission. Despiting being passed the House with bipartisan support, and did have some Republican support in the Senate, it was ultimately filibustered by Republicans.
***minor***News was later leaked by a staffer that Pelosi was going with a select committee, which she confirmed a few days later.
***minor***Only two Republicans, Reps. Cheney and Adam Kinzinger (IL) voted in favour of it.
***minor***Speaker Pelosi on Sunday officially named Rep. Kinzinger to fill one of the spots, which he accepted. Cheney had been chosen and accepted the week prior.
core_claims_reader_3: Rep. Jim Banks claims he was rejected by Pelosi for the Jan. 6 Select Committee because she doesn't want tough questions on her responsibility for security at Capitol Hill
House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy's suggested 5 Republicans to the select committee but pulled the suggestions after two of them were rejected by Nancy Pelosi
Jim Banks claimed that never before had the Speaker of the House rejected the representatives of a minority party submitted for a select committee
Jim Banks suggests documents from the Speaker's office are not released because the Speaker of the House (Pelosi) was involved and a breakdown of leadership occurred
Congress wanted to form a special commission to investigate the Jan. 6 events but this was filibustered by Republicans
core_claims_reader_4: Jim Banks and Jim Jordan were rejected from Pelosi’s select committee to investigate the January 6 Capitol riot
Jim Banks sees Pelosi as responsible for the breakdown on Jan 6 and therefore afraid of “tough questions” and “only interested in a narrative”
Congress had considered investigating the Capitol riot via a special commission which was ultimately filibustered by Republicans
Only two Republicans, Cheney and Kinzinger voted in favor of a select committee
Pelosi asked Kinzinger and Cheney to fill spots on the committee, with both of them accepting

articles.article_title: Trump Rejects 'Fake' Jan. 6 Panel: 'Will Nancy Investigate Herself?'
core_claims_gemini_naive: Former President Trump calls the January 6th select committee a 'Fake and highly partisan' body.
Trump questions whether the committee will investigate Speaker Pelosi's role in Capitol security on January 6th, including her decisions regarding National Guard deployment.
Trump suggests the committee should investigate alleged voter fraud in the 2020 election.
Trump demands the release of surveillance footage from January 6th to investigate the alleged roles of Antifa and Black Lives Matter.
Trump calls for a thorough investigation into the death of Ashli Babbitt and alleges a cover-up.
Trump claims the shooter was allegedly connected to a top House Democrat, implying a conflict of interest for Pelosi and the committee.
Trump criticizes the Justice Department for clearing the Babbitt shooter.
Trump accuses Democrats of using partisan investigations to target conservatives and Republicans.
core_claims_llama: Pelosi has a conflict of interest in investigating the January 6 Capitol riot.
Pelosi was in charge of Capitol security on January 6.
Pelosi rejected the National Guard before the protest and the joint sessions of Congress to certify the 2020 presidential election.
Surveillance footage of the January 6 protest at the Capitol is being withheld.
The shooter of Ashli Babbitt was allegedly a 'head of security' for a top House Democrat.
core_claims_reader_1: full transparency of the events of Jan. 6 are compromised because of the withholding of surveillance footage of the protest at the Capitol and the storming of it.
the protected shooter of Babbitt was allegedly a "head of security" for a top House Democrat
she [Babbitt] was the lone fatality attributed to the melee. The other deaths were ruled to have been suicides and natural causes.
The hearing will start at 9:30 a.m. ET with opening statements from Homeland Security Chairman Bennie Thompson, D-Miss. - the chair of the select committee - and Rep. Liz Cheney, R-Wyo.

Cheney was removed from her past position of GOP leadership in the House for her breaking from the party and voting to impeach the former president for incitement of insurrection after Trump left office.
core_claims_reader_2: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi is advancing the January 6 Select Committee in a partisan manner, as it includes only Democrats and two Republicans who are critical of former President Donald Trump, neither of whom were approved by House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy.
Former President Trump accuses Pelosi of having a conflict of interest in the investigation.

***subclaim*** the January 6 Select Committee, led by Speaker Nancy Pelosi, will begin its hearings by listening to testimony from four law enforcement officers who defended the Capitol during the storming. The hearings will include opening statements from Homeland Security Chairman Bennie Thompson (D-Miss.), the committee's chair, and Rep. Liz Cheney (R-Wyo.), one of the two anti-Trump Republicans on the committee.

***subclaim*** Cheney was removed from her past position of GOP leadership in the House for her breaking from the party and voting to impeach the former president for incitement of insurrection after Trump left office.
core_claims_reader_3: Donald Trump attacks Nancy Pelosi over the investigation of the Jan. 6 Select Committee into the insurrection
Donald Trump tried to shift the blame for the Jan. 6 events on Pelosi because she was in charge of Capitol security
Donald Trump complained about voter fraud that should be investigated instead of the insurrection
Full transparency of the events of Jan. 6 are compromised because surveillance footage is withheld
Donald Trump claimed Black Lives Matters and ANTIFA played a role in the insurrection
core_claims_reader_4: Donald Trump called out Nancy Pelosi’s conflict of interest
Surveillance footage of January 6 is withheld
Trump claims that the shooter of Babbitt was “head of security” for a top House Democrat
Babbitt's death was the only fatality directly caused by the melee

Hearings conducted by Pelosi's Jan 6 select committee will start at 9:30am with opening statements from Homeland Security Chairman Bennie Thompson, D-Miss. - the chair of the select committee - and Rep. Liz Cheney, R-Wyo
